ewgraph 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Package index

All functions

density_over_0_1()
Create vector of densities over [0, 1]
ew_S()
Get the number of segments, i.e. number of rows, of an equal width graph.
ew_add_h_leftright()
Add left and right interpolated and extrapolated heights to segments of equal width graph.
ew_add_surface()
Add surface and cumulative surface to segments of equal width graph.
ew_d()
Probability density function for ew_graph
ew_from_vec()
Create an equal width probability graph from vector v
ew_get_cumsurface()
Get the cumulative surface column of an equal width graph.
ew_get_h()
Get the h column of an equal width graph.
ew_get_h_left()
Get the h_left column of an equal width graph.
ew_get_h_right()
Get the h_right column of an equal width graph.
ew_get_p()
Get the p column of an equal width graph.
ew_get_surface()
Get the surface column of an equal width graph.
ew_halfsegment_cumh_p()
In ew half segment, given cumulative value for h, find corresponding p value
ew_high_density_interval()
highest part of the graph with a given cumulative chance density
ew_maxcumh_p()
maximum error rate for given certainty
ew_maxh()
Return the (possibly interpolated) highest value of h, h_left, or h_right and corresponding error rate, p.
ew_middle_peaked()
Return TRUE iff the highest value of h is reached neither for the h_left of the first segment nor for the h_right of the last segment
ew_mincumh_p()
minimum error rate for given certainty
ew_round_prob()
Round probability value in accordance with number of segments of equal width graph
ew_validate()
Check whether object is a valid equal width graph
find_non_monotone_pairs()
Find input and output pairs of a function that are not monotone rising.
is_monotone_rising()
Checks if a function is monotone rising over a specified interval.
nonnegint()
Check whether object is vector of non negative integers
partition()
Partition line piece on the real line into equally sized consecutive segments
partition_0_1()
Partition [0, 1] into equally sized consecutive segments
posint()
Check whether object is vector of positive integers
unity()
One argument constant function that returns 1

Developed by Crist-Jan Doedens.
